column4: the choice is yours. My personal experience was that when I upgraded I had hassles. Did a clean install and everything worked fine
try "ls /media
what's in there?
any mention of your usb stick?
not sure. If you "ls /media/sbd1" is there anything in the results which suggests it's your usb stick?
when I plug mine in, mine is loaded as /media/Kingston
what about copying to your floppy?
yep, you got the idea
/media is usually the correct place. Are you expecting anything to be on your floppy at this stage?
The colours refer to whether it is a file, directory etc etc
IIRC sdb is pan external device. Do you have one?
it might well be that sdb1 IS your usb drive. Could that be so?
what message do you get?
And if you try with a "sudo" in front?
Progress!
damn!
jorvis beat me to it!
in your case that should probably read something like "cp -r . /media/sdb1"
and maybe with "sudo" in front
or "cp ./yourfolder /media/sdb1"
Puzzled too
My first thought is that it suggests that sdb1 isn't your usb stick, but rather another device
which means sdb1 isn't your USB stick
